com.tabuto.j2dgf.collision
Class CollisionDetector

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      com.tabuto.j2dgf.collision.CollisionDetector
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CollisionBoundDetector, TimeCollisionDetector, ZetatronEatingSeed, ZetatronEatingZretador, ZetatronReproduction, ZlifeEatingSeed, ZlifeReproduction, ZretadorEatingZlife, ZretadorReproduction
public class CollisionDetector
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable

abstract class CollisionDetector

The CollisionDetector class provide to check the position of each sprite registered in one or two SpriteGroup.

When a collision is checked, the class calls a CollisionAction(int, int)method for the collided sprites This class extends Observable class 'couse let its observer to know when a collision occurs

To use this Class simply extends it and override the CollisionAction(int, int). After that register this class on the CollisionManager present in the Game2D.

Version:
0.7.0
Author:
tabuto83
See Also:
CollisionManager, CollisionBoundDetector, Game2D, Serialized Form

Field Summary
protected  boolean ACTIVE
          The current State of this CollisionDetector, if true the CollisionDetector scan the SpriteGroup in search of Collision, if false, does it not!
protected  double DISTANCE

t

private transient java.lang.Thread t

RandomSleep

protected int RandomSleep
A random sleep time to let other collisionDetectors threads to execute!

Name

protected java.lang.String Name
Collision String Name is used by setName() methods to store the Class Name that extends a CollisionDetector. So, if you write a MonsterVsWall class that extends CollisionDetector, the setName methods set Name as "MonsterVsWall". This name is passed to the Observers of this class when a collision occurs. See the Java Observer and Observable Class.

See Also:
Observable

Method Detail

active

public void active()
Active the CollisionDetector

checkCollision

public void checkCollision()
Check the sprite group in search of collisions. When a collision occurs it calls a CollisionAction method.

CollisionAction

public void CollisionAction(int indexG1,
                            int indexG2)
Called when a collision is detected. Calls the routines to do when two Sprite of their own groups collides.

Parameters:
indexG1 - int Hash code of first collided Sprite
indexG2 - int Hash code of second collided Sprite

setName

public void setName()
Collision String Name is used by setName() methods to store the Class Name that extends a CollisionDetector. So, if you write a MonsterVsWall class that extends CollisionDetector, the setName methods set Name as "MonsterVsWall". This name is passed to the Observers of this class when a collision occurs. See the Java Observer and Observable Class.
